io.vertx.ext.web.api.contract

Class RouterFactoryOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.vertx.ext.web.api.contract.RouterFactoryOptions

  • public class RouterFactoryOptions
extends Object
    Author:
    Francesco Guardiani @slinkydeveloper

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean DEFAULT_MOUNT_NOT_IMPLEMENTED_HANDLER
      By default, RouterFactory mounts Not Implemented handler
      static boolean DEFAULT_MOUNT_RESPONSE_CONTENT_TYPE_HANDLER
      By default, RouterFactory will mount ResponseContentTypeHandler when required
      static boolean DEFAULT_MOUNT_VALIDATION_FAILURE_HANDLER
      Deprecated. 
      Router Factory won't manage the validation errors anymore. You must use Router.errorHandler(int, Handler) with 400 error
      static String DEFAULT_OPERATION_MODEL_KEY
      By default, RouterFactory will not expose operation configuration in the the routing context
      static boolean DEFAULT_REQUIRE_SECURITY_HANDLERS
      By default, RouterFactory requires security handlers to be defined while calling getRouter() or it will throw an Exception

      boolean isRequireSecurityHandlers() 
      RouterFactoryOptions setMountNotImplementedHandler(boolean mountOperationsWithoutHandler)
      If true, Router Factory will automatically mount an handler that return HTTP 501 status code for each operation where you didn't specify an handler.
      RouterFactoryOptions setMountResponseContentTypeHandler(boolean mountResponseContentTypeHandler)
      If true, when required, the factory will mount a ResponseContentTypeHandler
      RouterFactoryOptions setMountValidationFailureHandler(boolean mountGlobalValidationFailureHandler)
      Deprecated. 
      Router Factory won't manage the validation errors anymore. You must use Router.errorHandler(int, Handler) with 400 error
      RouterFactoryOptions setOperationModelKey(String operationModelKey)
      When set, an additional handler will be created to expose the operation model in the routing context under the given key.
      RouterFactoryOptions setRequireSecurityHandlers(boolean requireSecurityHandlers)
      If true, when you call RouterFactory.getRouter() the factory will mount for every path the required security handlers and, if a security handler is not defined, it throws an RouterFactoryException

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_MOUNT_VALIDATION_FAILURE_HANDLER

        @Deprecated
public static final boolean DEFAULT_MOUNT_VALIDATION_FAILURE_HANDLER
        Deprecated. Router Factory won't manage the validation errors anymore. You must use Router.errorHandler(int, Handler) with 400 error
        By default, RouterFactory doesn't mount validation failure handler
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final boolean DEFAULT_REQUIRE_SECURITY_HANDLERS
        By default, RouterFactory requires security handlers to be defined while calling getRouter() or it will throw an Exception

      • toJson

        public JsonObject toJson()

      • isMountValidationFailureHandler

        @Deprecated
public boolean isMountValidationFailureHandler()
        Deprecated. Router Factory won't manage the validation errors anymore. You must use Router.errorHandler(int, Handler) with 400 error
        Returns:

      • setMountValidationFailureHandler

        @Deprecated
public RouterFactoryOptions setMountValidationFailureHandler(boolean mountGlobalValidationFailureHandler)
        Deprecated. Router Factory won't manage the validation errors anymore. You must use Router.errorHandler(int, Handler) with 400 error
        Enable or disable validation failure handler. If you enable it during router creation a failure handler that manages ValidationException will be mounted. You can change the validation failure handler with with function RouterFactory.setValidationFailureHandler(Handler). If failure is different from ValidationException, next failure handler will be called.
        Parameters:
        mountGlobalValidationFailureHandler -
        Returns:
        this object

      • isMountNotImplementedHandler

        public boolean isMountNotImplementedHandler()

      • setMountNotImplementedHandler

        public RouterFactoryOptions setMountNotImplementedHandler(boolean mountOperationsWithoutHandler)
        If true, Router Factory will automatically mount an handler that return HTTP 501 status code for each operation where you didn't specify an handler. You can customize the response with Router.errorHandler(int, Handler)
        Parameters:
        mountOperationsWithoutHandler -
        Returns:
        this object

      • isRequireSecurityHandlers

        public boolean isRequireSecurityHandlers()

      • setRequireSecurityHandlers

        public RouterFactoryOptions setRequireSecurityHandlers(boolean requireSecurityHandlers)
        If true, when you call RouterFactory.getRouter() the factory will mount for every path the required security handlers and, if a security handler is not defined, it throws an RouterFactoryException
        Parameters:
        requireSecurityHandlers -
        Returns:
        this object

      • isMountResponseContentTypeHandler

        public boolean isMountResponseContentTypeHandler()

      • setMountResponseContentTypeHandler

        public RouterFactoryOptions setMountResponseContentTypeHandler(boolean mountResponseContentTypeHandler)
        If true, when required, the factory will mount a ResponseContentTypeHandler
        Parameters:
        mountResponseContentTypeHandler -
        Returns:

      • getOperationModelKey

        public String getOperationModelKey()

      • setOperationModelKey

        public RouterFactoryOptions setOperationModelKey(String operationModelKey)
        When set, an additional handler will be created to expose the operation model in the routing context under the given key. When the key is null, the handler is not added.
        Parameters:
        operationModelKey -
        Returns:
